review_blob: Tap. London Dec 2014. Quite floral, sweet. Cloudy, big frothy head. Ok beer, but a tad too sweet and floral for me. And somehow I think beers like these drink better from a bottle (in a glas)...
Bottle. London Dec 2014. Great beer, balanced. Darker than imagined. Great label btw. Full, full on. Caramely and sweet, rich, strong. A good beer.

Had this in London at the end of 2014 and it summed up the best experiences of the year I felt (a great year for beer btw). Although light it packs quite a punch and reminded me of the old unfiltered Ratsherrn pale Ale, Riedenburgers Dolden Sud, Crews PAs... modern classics if you wish (I live in Hamburg, so from a German perspective). It is a great beer. I cant believe this is only 35 IBUs; being low in sugar and alcohol it comes across way sharper and fresher (well it says 45 IBU elsewhere I see now). In the midst of a rainy London December, this made me think of summer again. Shows the essence of an IPA; perhaps less post modern, than prototypical.
